newsitem.title: ITALY: Prodi hopes lower Italy CPI will lead to rate cuts.
newsitem.headline: Prodi hopes lower Italy CPI will lead to rate cuts.

text.p: Italian Prime Minister Romano Prodi said that he hoped that falling inflation would lead to reductions in official Italian interest rates.
Preliminary data from 10 sample Italian cities last week indicated a November year-on-year inflation rate of 2.6 percent, down from 3.0 percent in October.
"Inflation at 2.6 percent is a level we can be proud of. I hope that the cost of money may finally fall. I hope we can have a future without interest rates which kill you," he told reporters.
Prodi, on a visit to this northeast Italian port city, said the Italian economy had touched its lowest point in July.
"But since then we are already seeing a slight but continuous revival. Government measures will take the country into a situation of recovery next year," he said.
